item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, October 1, 2024 at 3:30 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Boris Vallejo and the pixel art of the demoscene (87 points | 26 comments)
2. Bop Spotter (1738 points | 306 comments)
3. BorgBackup 2.0 supports Rclone – over 70 cloud providers in addition to SSH (70 points | 20 comments)
4. Matrix-Libera IRC Bridge Temporary Shutdown, a Retrospective (2023) (8 points | 3 comments)
5. Show HN: qrframe – generate beautiful qr codes with javascript code (113 points | 14 comments)
6. PyTorch Native Architecture Optimization: Torchao (66 points | 17 comments)
7. MusicBrainz: An open music encyclopedia (215 points | 43 comments)
8. AI chipmaker Cerebras files for IPO (126 points | 70 comments)
9. Launch HN: Inkeep (YC W23) – Copilot for Support (think Cursor for help desks) (93 points | 53 comments)
10. Essential Node in Global Semiconductor Supply Chain Hit by Hurricane Helene (19 points | 3 comments)
11. Fix photogrammetry bridges so that they are not "solid" underneath (33 points | 3 comments)
12. Show HN: Venator – open-source Threat Detection Platform (13 points | discuss)
13. Show HN: A macOS app to prevent sound quality degradation on AirPods (135 points | 180 comments)
14. GnuCash 5.9 (186 points | 93 comments)
15. Phrase matching in Marginalia Search (138 points | 20 comments)
16. A coffee table that walks (12 points | 4 comments)
17. Keep Track: 3D Satellite Toolkit (145 points | 35 comments)

19. A Comprehensive Analysis of Package Hallucinations by Code Generating LLMs (11 points | discuss)
20. Ask HN: Any good essays/books/advice about software sales? (98 points | 46 comments)
21. Reddit policy changes make sitewide protests nearly impossible (17 points | 4 comments)
22. The best browser bookmarking system is files (171 points | 127 comments)
23. Two new books on John Calhoun and his rodent experiments (97 points | 57 comments)
24. Show HN: Facad. The ls alternative making terminals cooler than GUIs (79 points | 56 comments)
25. California bans legacy admissions at private universities (424 points | 416 comments)
26. The fight to save Chile's white strawberry (90 points | 28 comments)
27. How we built ngrok's data platform (144 points | 38 comments)
28. Peer Calls: WebRTC peer to peer calls for everyone (107 points | 35 comments)
29. Tips for Building and Deploying Robots (100 points | 23 comments)
30. Typewise (YC S22) Is Hiring a Senior AI Back End Engineer (Python, Europe) ( | hide)
